title: What Does Dragon’s Blood Incense Mean?

steps.title: Dragon’s blood incense is believed to have spiritual and healing powers.
steps.content: Dragon’s blood incense is believed to have spiritual and healing powers. For thousands of years, people have burned dragon’s blood incense to soothe their bodies and spirits. This earthy and sweet-smelling incense is thought to: [1] X Research source Banish and protect against negative energy Promote spiritual healing and relaxation Boost creativity, passion, and motivation Heal skin ulcers and sores Aid digestive health Reduce inflammation Repel and kill bacteria, viruses, and fungi

steps.title: Protects against negative energy.
steps.content: Protects against negative energy. Dragon’s blood incense is considered a powerful energy cleanser. Burning this incense in your home or during your spiritual practice might remove and repel negative energy to help you attract positivity and peace. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Amplifies energy, healing, and relaxation.
steps.content: Amplifies energy, healing, and relaxation. Burning dragon’s blood incense can strengthen your spiritual connection and help you enter a calm and contemplative state. This might help you get in touch with your higher self to promote healing, confidence, and increased intuition. [3] X Research source For instance, burn dragon’s blood incense as you meditate , do yoga , practice mindfulness , or pray.

steps.title: Boosts passion and inner strength.
steps.content: Boosts passion and inner strength. Fiery red dragon’s blood incense is associated with the divine masculine and fire. Its bold energy is believed to infuse you with creativity and drive, helping you set goals, overcome challenges, and manifest your dreams . [4] X Research source Dragon’s blood incense is associated with honor, reverence, and power, which makes it great to burn as you manifest. Dragon’s blood incense is also tied to romantic passion, as it can boost your desire, love life, and fertility. In astrology, dragon’s blood incense is associated with Mars, the planet of motivation and assertiveness. Dragon’s blood incense might be especially powerful if your sun sign is in Aries, Leo, or Sagittarius. This incense can boost these fire signs’ traits.

steps.title: Treats skin ulcers.
steps.content: Treats skin ulcers. When used as an ointment or cream, the antimicrobial properties of dragon’s blood can heal diabetic ulcers and bed sores. It can also reduce ulcer-related pain. [5] X Research source Dragon’s blood might also help treat esophageal, stomach, and intestinal ulcers, though there is less scientific evidence. Note: More research is needed to evaluate the ability of dragon’s blood to treat ulcers. Talk to your doctor before using it for your condition.

steps.title: Promotes digestion.
steps.content: Promotes digestion. Dragon’s blood supplements can kill bacteria that cause diarrhea and dysentery. [6] X Research source It can also reduce symptoms related to ulcerative colitis and reduce gastrointestinal bleeding. [7] X Research source Note: Research is still limited on the digestive benefits of dragon’s blood. Meet with your healthcare provider first before taking dragon’s blood.

steps.title: Fights inflammation, pain, and pathogens.
steps.content: Fights inflammation, pain, and pathogens. Dragon’s blood ointments and supplements are anti-inflammatory, which can help skin wounds heal faster. It is also considered an analgesic that helps relieve pain. [8] X Research source The compounds in dragon’s blood extract can repel and kill many types of bacteria, viruses, and fungi, too. [9] X Research source Note: Consult with your doctor about taking dragon’s blood before using it to deal with any inflammation or pain.

steps.title: Helps with diabetic treatments.
steps.content: Helps with diabetic treatments. In animal studies, injecting rats with dragon’s blood extract had an antidiabetic effect. It prevented glucose activity and limited the amount of glucose in rats' blood after they were given sugar. Note: Talk to your doctor before taking dragon’s blood to help with your diabetic treatments, as research is still very limited.

steps.title: Fights against cancer.
steps.content: Fights against cancer. While research is limited, dragon’s blood extract might prevent tumor growth. It can potentially suppress cancer cells from forming, too. [10] X Research source Note: More research is needed to understand the anticancer effects of dragon’s blood. Consult with your doctor before using it.

steps.title: Burn dragon’s blood incense as you meditate, pray, or manifest.
steps.content: Burn dragon’s blood incense as you meditate, pray, or manifest. To feel the spiritual benefits of dragon’s blood incense , light a stick, close your eyes, and focus on the rich aroma. Then, set your intention for your spiritual practice, whether it’s to cleanse your energy, enhance your spiritual connection, feel relaxed, or make your dreams a reality. [11] X Research source Using crystals in your spiritual practice can amplify the effects of dragon’s blood incense. For instance, hold obsidian to banish negativity or rose quartz to bring peace. [12] X Research source If you have a Wicca practice, burn dragon’s blood incense to boost the power of banishing rituals. Or, use it to cast a love spell , luck spell, or wealth spell. [13] X Research source

steps.title: Use dragon’s blood oils and supplements for health benefits.
steps.content: Use dragon’s blood oils and supplements for health benefits. If you’re dealing with a skin ulcer or inflammation, use a dragon’s blood ointment to help reduce your symptoms. Or, fight bacteria and improve your gut health by taking a dragon’s blood supplement . [14] X Research source There are very few side effects associated with dragon’s blood, though research is still limited. Do not use or take dragon’s blood if you are taking blood-thinning medications. In some studies, it’s had a blood-thinning effect. Note: Talk to your health care provider before using or taking dragon’s blood. This ensures that it’s right for you and is safe to use with any other medications.

steps.title: Dragon’s blood is a red resin that comes from Dracaena trees.
steps.content: Dragon’s blood is a red resin that comes from Dracaena trees. Dragon’s blood resin naturally forms in these ancient trees. It was commonly used in ancient Greece, Rome, India, China, and the Middle East as a medicine, dye, varnish, and in spiritual rituals. [15] X Research source Dragon’s blood resin comes from the island of Socotra (present-day Yemen), as well as Africa, Australia, Asia, and Central America. Dragon’s blood gets its name from its deep red hue and the Dracaena trees it forms in. Dracaena comes from the Greek word drakainia which means “female dragon.” Most dragon’s blood resin is extracted from Dracaena draco and Dracaena cinnabari . It can also come from trees in the genus Croton , Pterocarpus , and Calamus . Some incense brands sell blue dragon’s blood incense. It is also made with red dragon’s blood resin but has a subtler aroma.
